dct_title_s: NOVA ORBIS TABULA, ad usum Serenissimi BURGUNDIAE DUCIS
dct_description_sm: [1696], undated. Issued in his: Atlas nouveau contenant toutes les parties du monde ... -- M.DC.XCVI [1696].

[1725-1750], with the added imprint: A Amsterdam Chez R. & J. Ottens. (upper right). Secondary title centered above two hemispheres: MAPPE MONDE ou Description DU GLOBE Terrestre & Aquatique PRESENTEE A MONSEIGNEUR LE DUC DE BOURGOGNE Par Son tres Humble et tres Obeissant Serviteur H: Jaillot. Dedication: Presentee a Monseigneur le Duc de Bourgogne.

1792, with title above the map removed. Title and imprint centered above the two hemispheres changed to: MAPPE MONDE ou Description DU GLOBE Terrestre & Aquatique suivant les Dernieres & Meilleures A. AMSTERDAM. Ches I.B. ELWE. MDCCXCII. Issued in his: Atlas. -- Amstelaedami, [1792]. Reissued in his: Atlas. -- Amstelodami, [1808].
Issued in: Atlas royal a lâ€™usage de Monseigneur le Duc de Bourgogne ... / Chez Nicholas de Fer. -- A Paris, 1695. Reissued in 1699.
Shirley 561 (Plate 13); LC 5956; Koeman II, El 2(3), El 3; Maritime 89(3).

California with a deeply indented northern coastline labeled Isle de Californie, with numerous place names noted. Map surrounded by eight figures. The four above the hemispheres represent the arts and government. The four below represent the continents.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
